meanings.definition: To make a sharp, clattering sound
meanings.sent1: The branches clopped against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent2: I heard the horse clopped along the cobblestone street.
meanings.sent3: The wooden spoon clopped loudly against the pot as she stirred the soup.
meanings.sent4: Her heels clopped on the marble floor as she walked through the hallway.
meanings.sent5: The hammer clopped against the metal, creating a rhythmic beat.

meanings.definition: The sound of a horse's hoof hitting the ground
meanings.sent1: The clopped of the horse's hooves echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I recognized the familiar clopped of my horse approaching.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clopped startled the birds in the nearby trees.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic clopped of the horses signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The distant clopped of hooves grew louder as the riders approached.
